DOC.brief_summary: The Pilot Clinical Investigation planned is a prospective, unblinded randomized pilot trial comparing sedation management using a protocol based on responsiveness with standard sedation management. The hypothesis is that responsiveness will improve a range of patient-based and economic outcomes, including the duration of mechanical ventilation and duration of coma in the ICU. The purpose of the pilot study is to gather information for designing a full study that might show the validity of the outcome hypothesis.
DOC.criteria: Patients mechanically ventilated via an endotracheal tube and receiving intravenous sedation with a hypnotic agent (midazolam or other benzodiazepine) or propofol by continuous infusion.
